text.p: Italian debt markets make a late recovery ahead of preliminary Italian consumer prices data due after the market closed, but traders said the tone was bearish.
"We've had a sell-off on technical factors and now we're just waiting for the CPI," one broker in London said.
"The figures will give new direction. If they're nothing special then the market will go down," he added.

Six sample cities publish their data after 1630 GMT today and a further four release theirs on Friday. Forecasts are for 0.25 percent month on month after 0.1 percent in October, and 2.6 percent year on year after October's 3.0 percent.
The market is agog with speculation about when the lira might return to the ERM, with differing expectations for this weekend, the end of November and later in December.
